column4: I'm trying to 'mount' an internal hard drive in ' / ' and having a hell of time.  I've tried WIKI's and the Ubuntu Help site. How do you do this? I'm using UBUNTU LINUX - Hardy
[_Zeus_] Wherever it needs to be mounted so it shows up next to 'My Book' & 'File System' when I go to Computer.
I AM USING LINUX . . . UBUNTU LINUX

[_Zeus_] ==> Anytime I mention the word "Computer" everyone imediately thinks I'm using Windows.  I'm just trying to mount this damn volume so it shows up next to "File System". How do I do this??? I've tried my own research, to no avail. Please Help.
What are you trying to mount and where do you want to mount it to?
okay, And where are you trying to mount it to?

Are you on a LiveCD right now or are you on your normal install? I'm just trying to get an idea of where you want to mount this. If you're running your normal install, you've already got something mounted to / , so you'd need to mount it somewhere else.
Normal Install.  Just wherever it "needs" to go, to be a permanent hard drive.  Eventually, I'm going to try and move the '/home' & '/usr/bin' directories there . . . if that helps any.
Well, you can create a directory in /media/  name it anything you want and mount the partition there.
can I move '/home' & 'usr/bin' onto that partition if I do that?  This is a second hard drive, the filesystem is installed on 'sda' and i'm dealing with 'sdb'
You can move /home there, but not /usr/bin/ as well.
let me guess, that's got to be on another partition, if I want to move it, right?
I don't know of any way to mount a partition to two mountpoints, so yes.
Okay, so I'm going to do this:  sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /media/slave ext3      . . . . right?
